name: EPIC 201497682
scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 201497682 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 201497682 is a star with 0.78 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.55 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

EPIC 201497682 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 201497682 system


EPIC 201497682 b

EPIC 201497682 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 201497682 b is 0.26076 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 201497682 b is 0.692 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, EPIC 201497682 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system EPIC 201497682, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
